User: What are the requirements to stay over 60 days? {#stay-over-60-days}
Requirements:
[MANDATORY] Apply for VITAS (limited to 60 days + 2 extensions, max 180 days)
[MANDATORY] Convert to KITAS within 60 days of arrival (otherwise, must leave)
[MANDATORY] Maintain KITAS validity (no gaps between extensions)
[MANDATORY] Stay in Indonesia (cannot leave without new KITAS)

Deviation from Requirement:
Extensions: VITAS can be extended ‚Üí KITAS converted during extension
Work permit: RPTKA + DKP-TKA ‚Üí KITAS with work permit (same validity)
Change of status: KITAS ‚Üí KITAP ‚Üí new KITAS ‚Üí no need to leave

Probability of Approval:...

Hi! Based on the provided context, here‚Äôs a quick summary in Italian:
[PRICE]. Immigration offices in Bali are more focused on immigration extensions and VOA extensions than new KITAS applications.
[PRICE]. If you need a KITAS, it‚Äôs generally better to open it through a sponsor in your home country or through a company in Indonesia.
[PRICE]. Offices can help with questions and paperwork, but they don‚Äôt have the authority to approve or deny applications (that‚Äôs done in Jakarta). For example, the office in Singaraja can explain the requirements and process, but they won‚Äôt check your documents or guarantee acceptance.
[PRICE]. For urgent cases, there is a fast-track process for extending your stay (E[PRICE]C), but it‚Äôs only available if you already have a valid KITAS or KITAP....

-- ## üìû Contact & Emergency Procedures {#emergency}

### **Lost/Stolen KITAS**
*Immediate Action**:
**Report to police** (police report required for visa reissue)
**Contact immigration** (within 24 hours)
**Apply for emergency KITAS extension** (IDR 1M-2M, USD 70-140)
**Pay re-entry fee** (IDR 500,000, USD 35)
**Prepare for immigration interview** (why did you not leave Indonesia earlier)
*Penalty**: KITAS cancelled + 6-month ban from Indonesia

(from KB source)
Indonesia's visa framework is divided into three main categories: Visitor Visas, Stay Permits (ITAS/ITAP), and Limited Stay Permits (ITAS/ITAP). Visitor Visas are for short-term stays (up to 60 days, extendable 2‚Äì3 times = 180 days max). ITAS/ITAP = Permanent Stay Permit (1 0r 2 years validity). ITAS is for workers, ITAP for investors, 9(9) for families, and 21A for retirement. Our visa experts can help you get the right permit for your situation and ensure legal compliance. Contact Bali Zero‚Äôs visa team now for personalized guidance. You can also download the complete Visa Types & Requirements Guide from our knowledge base for detailed information.

natural language summary

Context
Permenkumham No. 10/2017: Visa Procedures
Balizer 2025 KITAS List: Investor, Working, Family, Retirement, Student, Digital Nomad, Second Home
2025 KITAS/ITAS/ITAP/BRP updates: Ministerial Regulation No. 22/2023, Law No. 6/2011, Permenkumham No. 11/2024

Simplified Explanation (for this scenario)
KITAS = KITA (Kartu Izin Tinggal Terbatas) = Limited Stay Permit (same acronym different name)
KITAS is the new unified name for all visa types marked E (employment, investment, family, etc.)
KITAS replaces separate work permit (E23A), investor permit (E28A), and other E-visas
KITAS can be extended (not required to reapply from scratch) and renewed every year
Validity: 1 year, multiple entry/exit permitted
Cost: IDR 18M-36M onshore/offsetshore for 1 year
Process: Apply online ‚Üí Sponsoring company documents ‚Üí VITAS approval ‚Üí KITAS issuance ‚Üí Merp card...
